pullRequest.body:
Replacing it by more fine-grained imports. `Lean` is still imported in `Tactic.Basic` and `GCongr/Core`; these are left on purpose.

---

This needs a `shake`; help doing this is welcome.

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

| Mathlib.Tactic.FunProp.Mor | 97 | 100 | +3 (+3.09%) |

<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
There are 4801 files with changed transitive imports taking up over 199725 characters: this is too many to display!
You can run `scripts/import_trans_difference.sh all` locally to see the whole output.

</details>

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
Why does the commit summary tool report increase in imports? Does it ignore `import Lean`?

If I understand correctly, the summary script just counts the number of transitive import lines. So splitting one `import Lean` into several more fine-grained additions counts as an increase in the total number of imports, or so.
@adomani Is this correct? (I think is is reasonable behaviour of the summary comment.)

I thought that the import summary was a count of all transitive imports, so this looks like it should have been a "negative" (i.e. desirable) change.

I'll ping @jcommelin as he was the one who wrote that part of the PR summary script.

I think that I know what the issue is: the script looks for files in the `Mathlib` dir.  This Means that it counts transitive dependencies *inside mathlib* and absolute `import`lines for imports from dependencies.

This can be considered a borderline bug, but should explain the current behaviour.

Maybe we should kick all the leafs out of the counter if they don't start with `Mathlib.`.

bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11556704776/job/32165017516)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11556704776/job/32165017888)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: remove almost all `import Lean`
